main event: On 17 August 1953 in Peoria, Illinois, two civilian observers reported seeing an unidentified flying object resembling a baseball with a brilliant white color, which appeared to be suspended in the air and then slowly moved away. The object was later determined to be a balloon.
interesting points: The object was observed for approximately 30 minutes by multiple witnesses at different locations in Peoria.
Personnel of the 791st AC&W Squadron observed a half-moon shaped object in the same vicinity at the time of the sighting.
The AC&W Squadron at Hanna City did not detect any unusual tracks on radar in the area during the sighting.
Checks with local weather stations and airfields in the vicinity ruled out the possibility of weather balloons or aircraft causing the sighting.
The object was initially estimated to be the size of a baseball and had no observed trail or exhaust.
result: prosaic explanation: the object was determined to be a balloon
sighted object: unidentified flying object resembling a baseball with a brilliant white color
witnesses: two civilian observers and personnel of the 791st AC&W Squadron
photographs: no photographs were present in the report
